original: LIUNGMAN, Carl Gudmund Waldemar, Docent, Kapten, Djursholm, f Sthlm 27/1 83 av kyrkoh i S:t Clara Carl L o Sophie Malmberg, gm Annie Hasselblad. Studex, Handels-hochsch o Fredrich Wilhelmuniv i Berlin, fil kand, fil lic, fil dr. AIHS, KHS, ulöjtn, löjtn o kapten i I 10, kapten i I l:s reserv. Docent i nord o jämför folkminnesforskning v GbHS o i folkdiktsforskning v StHS, bitr dir o styr.led i AB F W Hasselblad & Co i Gbg 17—22, nu rev där, styr.led i Hasselblads Fotograf AB i Gbg o i Inst f folkminnes-forskn v GbHS. Ag o bebor villa i Djursholm o Älviksholni i Gillberga (Värml) samt ag tills m brod fastigh i Sthlm. Stip.resa t Ryssl mfl studieresor. Av trycket: Rekryt-utbildn v inf, Sv historia, En traditionsstu-die I o II, Två folkminnesundersökn, Sinnesvillor o sägenbildn, De sex stora religionernas grunddrag, Der Kampf zwischen Sommer und Winter, Traditionswanderungen Euphrat-Rhein I o II Traditionswanderungen Rhein-Jenissei I o II mfl samt ett flert art o rec i tidskr o dagspress. RSO, SM f beröml garn. Frimurare.
translated: LIUNGMAN, Carl Gudmund Waldemar, Associate Professor, Captain, Djursholm, born in Stockholm on January 27, 1883, son of the vicar of St. Clara Carl L and Sophie Malmberg, married to Annie Hasselblad. Studied at Handels-hochsch and Friedrich Wilhelm University in Berlin, Bachelor of Philosophy, Licentiate of Philosophy, Doctor of Philosophy. Served as Lieutenant, Lieutenant and Captain in Infantry Regiment 10, Captain in Infantry Regiment 1 Reserve. Associate Professor in Nordic and Comparative Folklore Research at the Gothenburg Historical Society and in Folk Poetry Research at the Stockholm Historical Society, Deputy Director and Board Member of AB F W Hasselblad & Co in Gothenburg from 1917 to 1922, currently retired, Board Member of Hasselblad's Photography AB in Gothenburg and the Institute for Folklore Research at the Gothenburg Historical Society. Owns and resides in a villa in Djursholm and Älviksholn in Gillberga (Värmland), and co-owns property in Stockholm with siblings. Awarded scholarships for trips to Russia and other study trips. Publications include: Recruit Training in Infantry, Swedish History, A Study of Tradition I and II, Two Folklore Surveys, Delusions and Legends, The Basic Principles of the Six Major Religions, The Struggle between Summer and Winter, Traditional Journeys from the Euphrates to the Rhine I and II, Traditional Journeys from the Rhine to the Yenisei I and II, and several articles and reviews in journals and newspapers. Awarded the Royal Order of the Seraphim, and received the Swedish Military Medal of Merit. Freemason.

structured.name: Carl Gudmund Waldemar Liungman
publication: Der Kampf zwischen Sommer und Winter
and several articles and reviews in journals and newspapers
